text:
Is there a way to attach edges recursively to `CodeInfo` objects? E.g. in the following example I want the redefinition of `f` to trigger recompilation of `h`, since `f` is a edge of `g`, which is an edge of `h`:
```julia> f() = 1
f (generic function with 1 method)

julia> @generated function g()
           ccall(:jl_safe_printf, Cvoid, (Cstring,), "g!\n")
           ci = code_lowered(() -> nothing)[1]
           ci.edges = [Core.Compiler.method_instances(f, Tuple{})[]]
           return ci
       end
g (generic function with 1 method)

julia> @generated function h()
           ccall(:jl_safe_printf, Cvoid, (Cstring,), "h!\n")
           ci = code_lowered(() -> nothing)[1]
           ci.edges = [Core.Compiler.method_instances(g, Tuple{})[]]
           return ci
       end
h (generic function with 1 method)

julia> h()
h!

julia> f() = 2
f (generic function with 1 method)

julia> h()

julia> ```

julia> f() = 2

julia>

text: did you figure out a way of doing so without forcing to run? I filed it as in issue when I ran into this: <https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/34962>
